question: Who was the first President of the United States?
funFact: George Washington was the first President of the United States, serving from 1789 to 1797. He's known as the 'Father of His Country' and set many precedents for the office.

question: Who was the President during the Civil War?
funFact: Abraham Lincoln was President during the Civil War (1861-1865) and issued the Emancipation Proclamation, which declared slaves in Confederate states free.

question: Who was the President during World War II?
funFact: Franklin D. Roosevelt was President for most of World War II (1933-1945), and Harry S. Truman succeeded him in 1945 and made the decision to drop atomic bombs on Japan.

question: Who was the youngest person to become President?
funFact: Theodore Roosevelt became President at age 42 after William McKinley's assassination in 1901. John F. Kennedy was the youngest elected President at age 43.

question: Which President is on the $1 bill?
funFact: George Washington appears on the $1 bill. He's also on the quarter and is the only person to appear on a currently circulating U.S. coin and bill.

question: Who was the only President to serve more than two terms?
funFact: Franklin D. Roosevelt was elected to four terms (1933-1945), the only President to serve more than two terms. The 22nd Amendment now limits Presidents to two terms.

question: Who was the President when the Berlin Wall fell?
funFact: George H.W. Bush was President when the Berlin Wall fell in 1989, marking the end of the Cold War and the reunification of Germany.

question: Who was the first African American President?
funFact: Barack Obama was the first African American President of the United States, serving from 2009 to 2017. He was also the first President born in Hawaii.

question: Which President is known for the Louisiana Purchase?
funFact: Thomas Jefferson orchestrated the Louisiana Purchase in 1803, doubling the size of the United States by acquiring 827,000 square miles from France for $15 million.

question: Who was the President during the Great Depression?
C: The Battle of the Somme (World War I)
funFact: Herbert Hoover was President when the Great Depression began in 1929, and Franklin D. Roosevelt succeeded him in 1933 and implemented the New Deal to address the crisis.

question: Who was the President during the Cuban Missile Crisis?
funFact: John F. Kennedy was President during the Cuban Missile Crisis in 1962, a 13-day confrontation that brought the world to the brink of nuclear war.

question: Who was the President when the United States entered World War I?
funFact: Woodrow Wilson was President when the United States entered World War I in 1917. He later proposed the League of Nations as part of his Fourteen Points.

question: Who was the President when the Panama Canal was completed?
funFact: The Panama Canal was completed in 1914 during Woodrow Wilson's presidency, though construction began under Theodore Roosevelt, who initiated the project.

question: Who was the President when the first man walked on the Moon?
funFact: Richard Nixon was President when Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin walked on the Moon on July 20, 1969. John F. Kennedy had set the goal to land on the Moon by the end of the 1960s.

question: Who was the President when the Civil Rights Act of 1964 was signed?
funFact: Lyndon B. Johnson signed the Civil Rights Act of 1964, one of the most significant pieces of civil rights legislation in American history, outlawing discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

question: Who was the President when the Vietnam War ended?
funFact: Gerald Ford was President when the Vietnam War officially ended in 1975, though the last U.S. troops had been withdrawn in 1973 during Richard Nixon's presidency.

question: Who was the President when the Watergate scandal occurred?
funFact: Richard Nixon was President during the Watergate scandal, which led to his resignation in 1974. It remains one of the biggest political scandals in U.S. history.

question: Who was the President when the 9/11 attacks occurred?
funFact: George W. Bush was President when the 9/11 attacks occurred on September 11, 2001. This event led to the War on Terror and the invasion of Afghanistan.

question: Who was the President when the Cold War ended?
funFact: George H.W. Bush was President when the Cold War effectively ended with the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989 and the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991.
